playn.core.gl

Interface GLBuffer.Float

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GLBuffer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL20Buffer.FloatImpl
    Enclosing interface:
    GLBuffer

    public static interface GLBuffer.Float
extends GLBuffer
    A buffer of 32-bit floats.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface playn.core.gl.GLBuffer

        GLBuffer.Float, GLBuffer.Short

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GLBuffer.Float add(float value)
      Adds a single value to this buffer.
      GLBuffer.Float add(float[] data, int offset, int length)
      Adds the supplied values to this buffer.
      GLBuffer.Float add(float x, float y)
      Adds the supplied pair of values to this buffer.
      GLBuffer.Float add(float m00, float m01, float m10, float m11, float tx, float ty)
      Adds the specified transform to this buffer.
      GLBuffer.Float add(int value)
      Adds an int to this float buffer.
      GLBuffer.Float add(InternalTransform xform)
      Adds the matrix for the supplied transform to this buffer.

      • Methods inherited from interface playn.core.gl.GLBuffer

        bind, byteSize, capacity, destroy, expand, position, send, skip

      • add

        GLBuffer.Float add(float[] data,
                 int offset,
                 int length)
        Adds the supplied values to this buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - the value to be added.
        offset - the offset into data at which to start adding.
        length - the number of values from data to add.
        Returns:
        this buffer for call chaining.

      • add

        GLBuffer.Float add(int value)
        Adds an int to this float buffer. TODO: rename this buffer from Float to something that reflects that it's for passing general data to a shader (compared to the Short buffer which is for passing elements).
